body:
Some connections seem to not get closed properly when a device is removed.  When closed by the remote end, a GUI error bar appears because of an undefined object entry.

### Steps to Reproduce ###

Unless noted otherwise, carry out on device A's GUI:

1. Add remote device B (which must be offering us a connection / listed as pending device).
2. Wait until it shows Connected (Unused) on A.
3. Observe that it is included in `GET /rest/system/connections`.
4. Wait for a pending folder notification from the remote device, but do not accept. [possibly not required / unrelated?]
5. Remove the remote device B through the GUI on A.
6. Observe that it is no longer included in `GET /rest/system/connections`.
7. Observe that the remote device (B) itself still lists our local device (A) as "Up to Date".  The connection is not really closed, there was no corresponding log message on A either.
8. Pause device A in B's GUI, leading to the connection being finally closed.
9. Observe the following GUI error message on A:

		Error: $scope.connections[arg.data.id] is undefined
		@http://127.0.0.1:8385/syncthing/core/syncthingController.js:221:13
		$broadcast@http://127.0.0.1:8385/vendor/angular/angular.js:14908:28
		successFn/<@http://127.0.0.1:8385/syncthing/core/eventService.js:27:32
		successFn@http://127.0.0.1:8385/syncthing/core/eventService.js:23:22
		$http/promise.success/<@http://127.0.0.1:8385/vendor/angular/angular.js:9452:13
		processQueue@http://127.0.0.1:8385/vendor/angular/angular.js:13337:27
		scheduleProcessQueue/<@http://127.0.0.1:8385/vendor/angular/angular.js:13353:39
		$eval@http://127.0.0.1:8385/vendor/angular/angular.js:14589:28
		$digest@http://127.0.0.1:8385/vendor/angular/angular.js:14405:31
		$apply@http://127.0.0.1:8385/vendor/angular/angular.js:14694:24
		scheduleApplyAsync/applyAsyncId<@http://127.0.0.1:8385/vendor/angular/angular.js:14984:22
		completeOutstandingRequest@http://127.0.0.1:8385/vendor/angular/angular.js:4959:10
		Browser/self.defer/timeoutId<@http://127.0.0.1:8385/vendor/angular/angular.js:5347:33
		logbar.js:11:22
			method http://127.0.0.1:8385/syncthing/development/logbar.js:11
			Angular 3
			successFn http://127.0.0.1:8385/syncthing/core/eventService.js:27
			successFn http://127.0.0.1:8385/syncthing/core/eventService.js:23
			Angular 9

Apparently the GUI tries to parse the DEVICE_DISCONNECTED event for a
connection which was already removed from the model.  â€‹

### Version Information

Syncthing Version: v1.5.0-rc.1 (6bbd24de122fbe3e58385d6f91f7ba8d7f2f0800) on device A, v1.4.2 on device B
OS Version: Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (both instances running on the same host if that matters)
Browser Version: Firefox 75.0 (64-bit)
